intro: Erysimum crassicaule, commonly known as the broad-leaved wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of broad, fleshy leaves. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers in late spring to early summer, which are borne on long, slender stems. Its flowers are typically arranged in clusters and attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erysimum crassicaule thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
